result.execSummary:
The defendant Tammy M. Widener was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tammy M. Widener is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tammy M. Widener was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tammy M. Widener

defendant.name: Widener, Tammy M.
defendant.address: W8891 Cty Road W, Antigo, WI 54409

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to reopen and amend judgment of conviction

Defendant Tammy M. Widener in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 9:14 am. State gives plea agreement, ct 1 Dismiss w/o prejudice, Ct 2 plea amend to 948.21(1)(a), Child Neglect,  withheld sentence 6 months probation, counseling, no violent contact with victim, costs & any other counseling deemed appropriate by agent, Def. may move to reopen & amend to D.C. 947.01(1), if completes probation,  Victim rights complied with.  Def. agrees with plea agreement.  Plea questionnaire & waiver rights filed.  Def. understands amended charge & penalties. Court will grant amendment Child Neglect, misdemeanor, 948.21(1)(a), no contest plea, Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights. Court will grant amend ct 2 Misdemeanor Child Neglect 948.21(1)(a). Atty Laufenberg is satisfied.  Court will find plea is freely & volunutarily given.  No addition facts by either party.  Court accepts plea & finds def. Guilty & direct clerk to enter JOC. Proceed with sentencing.  State gives statement. Atty Laufenberg gives sentencing argument.  Def. has nothing to say.  Court accepts & adopts plea agreement withheld sentence 6 months probation, any other counseling request or require deemed appropriate by agent, no violent contact with children, & costs, 2 days credit if revoked.  No DNA sample or surcharge ordered. 
 If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Def. advised of postconviction rights.

Defendant Tammy M. Widener in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:44 a.m. Statement by Atty Laufenberg. Bond remains.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tammy M. Widener in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def will waive right to preliminary.  Statement by Atty Laufenberg.  Written waiver completed.  Court reviews right to preliminary.  Def waives.  Court accepts waiver.  Court finds probable cause, information filed.  Waive reading.  Reserve all jurisdicational objections.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Court will accept pleas.  Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tammy M. Widener in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:39 a.m. Bond conditions reviewed. Copy of complaint received, reading waived, time limits for prelim hrg waived. Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Tammy M. Widener in court via video.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court vacates warrant.  Def does not have a copy of complaint.  Court reads charges with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an attorney.  State request signature bond with conditions.  Bond set by court  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
